title: How to Make Quick Easy Cupcakes

steps.headline: Measure out your ingredients.
steps.description: Having everything ready before you start mixing will keep you from forgetting an important ingredient.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).
Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan.
steps.description: If you don't have liners, just grease each cup with vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking.

steps.headline: Sift the flour, salt, and baking powder into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Use a sifter or a whisk to thoroughly incorporate the dry ingredients.

steps.headline: Add the sugar and butter.
steps.description: Stir just until the ingredients are combined.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, milk and vanilla.
steps.description: Mix everything together to form a smooth batter.

steps.headline: Stir in optional mix-ins.
steps.description: If you want to add chocolate chips, sprinkles, or another mix-in, stir it in now.

steps.headline: Divide the cupcake mixture evenly into the cupcake tin.
steps.description: Fill each up about 2/3 full. Leaving extra room at the top of each cup will prevent the cupcakes from rising too high in the cups and spilling over.

steps.headline: Bake the cupcakes.
steps.description: Place them in the oven to bake for 15 to 18 minutes. The cupcakes are done with a toothpick inserted into the center of a cake comes out clean.

steps.headline: Let the cupcakes cool before frosting.
steps.description: Place them on a cooling rack or the counter to let them cool completely.

steps.headline: Whip up the frosting of your choice to finish your cupcakes.
steps.description:
Pair your vanilla cupcakes with any type of frosting you like best. Here are a few easy recipes to try:
 Vanilla frosting
 Chocolate frosting
 Buttercream frosting

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan.
steps.description: If you don't have liners, grease the cups using vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking.

steps.headline: Pour all the ingredients into the same bowl.
steps.description: In this easy recipe, it doesn't matter in what order you pour them in. Choose a big bowl that will fit all the ingredients.

steps.headline: Beat the ingredients until the batter becomes creamy.
steps.description: Keep stirring until you no longer see dry bits of flour.

steps.headline: Divide the batter evenly into the cupcake cups.
steps.description: Fill each one 2/3 way full. Leaving extra space will give the cupcakes room to rise without spilling over the rims.

steps.headline: Bake the cupcakes for 15 to 20 minutes.
steps.description: Test to see whether the cupcakes are done by inserting a toothpick into the center of a cupcake. If it comes out clean, they're ready. If it's still wet, bake the cupcakes for another five minutes.

steps.headline: Let the cupcakes cool before frosting.
steps.description: Place them on a wire rack or on the counter to cool completely. If you frost them too quickly, the icing will melt off.

steps.headline: Frost the cupcakes with your favorite frosting.
steps.description:
Any flavor pairs great with these simple chocolate cupcakes. Choose your favorite frosting or make more than one, then spread it onto your cooled cupcakes. These recipes pair well with chocolate cupcakes:
 Cream cheese frosting
 Peanut butter frosting
 Chocolate chip frosting

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan.
steps.description: If you don't have liners, grease the cups using vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking.

steps.headline: Mix together the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Into a large bowl, add the strawberry jam, milk, vanilla, butter, eggs and sugar. Beat the mixture well to fully incorporate the ingredients.

steps.headline: Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
steps.description: Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt.

steps.headline: Stir the flour mixture into the wet batter.
steps.description: Use a spatula to gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet until just combined. Be sure not to overmix, since mixing too much can cause these cupcakes to turn out dense.

steps.headline: Divide the batter evenly into the cupcake cups.
steps.description: Fill each one 2/3 way full. Leaving extra space will give the cupcakes room to rise without spilling over the rims.

steps.headline: Bake the cupcakes for 20 to 25 minutes.
steps.description: Test to see whether the cupcakes are done by inserting a toothpick into the center of a cupcake. If it comes out clean, they're ready. If it's still wet, bake the cupcakes for another five minutes.

steps.headline: Let the cupcakes cool before frosting.
steps.description: Place them on a wire rack or on the counter to cool completely. If you frost them too quickly, the icing will melt off.

steps.headline: Frost the cupcakes with your favorite frosting.
steps.description:
The sweet taste of the strawberries pairs well with cream cheese, a simple buttercream or a complementary strawberry frosting. Try one of these recipes:
 Cream cheese frosting
 Buttercream
 Strawberry frosting

steps.headline: Finished.

text:
Vanilla Cupcakes Measure out your ingredients. Having everything ready before you start mixing will keep you from forgetting an important ingredient. Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).  Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan. If you don't have liners, just grease each cup with vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking. Sift the flour, salt, and baking powder into a mixing bowl. Use a sifter or a whisk to thoroughly incorporate the dry ingredients. Add the sugar and butter. Stir just until the ingredients are combined. Add the eggs, milk and vanilla. Mix everything together to form a smooth batter. Stir in optional mix-ins. If you want to add chocolate chips, sprinkles, or another mix-in, stir it in now. Divide the cupcake mixture evenly into the cupcake tin. Fill each up about 2/3 full. Leaving extra room at the top of each cup will prevent the cupcakes from rising too high in the cups and spilling over. Bake the cupcakes. Place them in the oven to bake for 15 to 18 minutes. The cupcakes are done with a toothpick inserted into the center of a cake comes out clean. Let the cupcakes cool before frosting. Place them on a cooling rack or the counter to let them cool completely. Whip up the frosting of your choice to finish your cupcakes. Pair your vanilla cupcakes with any type of frosting you like best. Here are a few easy recipes to try:
 Vanilla frosting
 Chocolate frosting
 Buttercream frosting Chocolate Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).  Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan. If you don't have liners, grease the cups using vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking. Pour all the ingredients into the same bowl. In this easy recipe, it doesn't matter in what order you pour them in. Choose a big bowl that will fit all the ingredients. Beat the ingredients until the batter becomes creamy. Keep stirring until you no longer see dry bits of flour. Divide the batter evenly into the cupcake cups. Fill each one 2/3 way full. Leaving extra space will give the cupcakes room to rise without spilling over the rims. Bake the cupcakes for 15 to 20 minutes. Test to see whether the cupcakes are done by inserting a toothpick into the center of a cupcake. If it comes out clean, they're ready. If it's still wet, bake the cupcakes for another five minutes. Let the cupcakes cool before frosting. Place them on a wire rack or on the counter to cool completely. If you frost them too quickly, the icing will melt off. Frost the cupcakes with your favorite frosting. Any flavor pairs great with these simple chocolate cupcakes. Choose your favorite frosting or make more than one, then spread it onto your cooled cupcakes. These recipes pair well with chocolate cupcakes:
 Cream cheese frosting
 Peanut butter frosting
 Chocolate chip frosting Strawberry Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).  Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan. If you don't have liners, grease the cups using vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking. Mix together the wet ingredients. Into a large bowl, add the strawberry jam, milk, vanilla, butter, eggs and sugar. Beat the mixture well to fully incorporate the ingredients. Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl. Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt. Stir the flour mixture into the wet batter. Use a spatula to gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet until just combined. Be sure not to overmix, since mixing too much can cause these cupcakes to turn out dense. Divide the batter evenly into the cupcake cups. Fill each one 2/3 way full. Leaving extra space will give the cupcakes room to rise without spilling over the rims. Bake the cupcakes for 20 to 25 minutes. Test to see whether the cupcakes are done by inserting a toothpick into the center of a cupcake. If it comes out clean, they're ready. If it's still wet, bake the cupcakes for another five minutes. Let the cupcakes cool before frosting. Place them on a wire rack or on the counter to cool completely. If you frost them too quickly, the icing will melt off. Frost the cupcakes with your favorite frosting. The sweet taste of the strawberries pairs well with cream cheese, a simple buttercream or a complementary strawberry frosting. Try one of these recipes:
 Cream cheese frosting
 Buttercream
 Strawberry frosting Finished.
sentences: Vanilla Cupcakes Measure out your ingredients.
Having everything ready before you start mixing will keep you from forgetting an important ingredient.
Preheat the oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).
Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan.
If you don't have liners, just grease each cup with vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking.
Sift the flour, salt, and baking powder into a mixing bowl.
Use a sifter or a whisk to thoroughly incorporate the dry ingredients.
Add the sugar and butter.
Stir just until the ingredients are combined.
Add the eggs, milk and vanilla.
Mix everything together to form a smooth batter.
Stir in optional mix-ins.
If you want to add chocolate chips, sprinkles, or another mix-in, stir it in now.
Divide the cupcake mixture evenly into the cupcake tin.
Fill each up about 2/3 full.
Leaving extra room at the top of each cup will prevent the cupcakes from rising too high in the cups and spilling over.
Bake the cupcakes.
Place them in the oven to bake for 15 to 18 minutes.
The cupcakes are done with a toothpick inserted into the center of a cake comes out clean.
Let the cupcakes cool before frosting.
Place them on a cooling rack or the counter to let them cool completely.
Whip up the frosting of your choice to finish your cupcakes.
Pair your vanilla cupcakes with any type of frosting you like best.

Here are a few easy recipes to try:
 Vanilla frosting
 Chocolate frosting
 Buttercream frosting Chocolate Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan.
If you don't have liners, grease the cups using vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking.
Pour all the ingredients into the same bowl.
In this easy recipe, it doesn't matter in what order you pour them in.
Choose a big bowl that will fit all the ingredients.
Beat the ingredients until the batter becomes creamy.
Keep stirring until you no longer see dry bits of flour.
Divide the batter evenly into the cupcake cups.
Fill each one 2/3 way full.
Leaving extra space will give the cupcakes room to rise without spilling over the rims.
Bake the cupcakes for 15 to 20 minutes.
Test to see whether the cupcakes are done by inserting a toothpick into the center of a cupcake.
If it comes out clean, they're ready.
If it's still wet, bake the cupcakes for another five minutes.
Let the cupcakes cool before frosting.
Place them on a wire rack or on the counter to cool completely.
If you frost them too quickly, the icing will melt off.
Frost the cupcakes with your favorite frosting.
Any flavor pairs great with these simple chocolate cupcakes.
Choose your favorite frosting or make more than one, then spread it onto your cooled cupcakes.

These recipes pair well with chocolate cupcakes:
 Cream cheese frosting
 Peanut butter frosting
 Chocolate chip frosting Strawberry Cupcakes Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
Place 12 cupcake liners into a cupcake pan.
If you don't have liners, grease the cups using vegetable oil or butter to keep the cupcakes from sticking.
Mix together the wet ingredients.
Into a large bowl, add the strawberry jam, milk, vanilla, butter, eggs and sugar.
Beat the mixture well to fully incorporate the ingredients.
Mix the dry ingredients in a separate bowl.
Sift together the flour, baking powder and salt.
Stir the flour mixture into the wet batter.
Use a spatula to gently fold the dry ingredients into the wet until just combined.
Be sure not to overmix, since mixing too much can cause these cupcakes to turn out dense.
Divide the batter evenly into the cupcake cups.
Fill each one 2/3 way full.
Leaving extra space will give the cupcakes room to rise without spilling over the rims.
Bake the cupcakes for 20 to 25 minutes.
Test to see whether the cupcakes are done by inserting a toothpick into the center of a cupcake.
If it comes out clean, they're ready.
If it's still wet, bake the cupcakes for another five minutes.
Let the cupcakes cool before frosting.
Place them on a wire rack or on the counter to cool completely.
If you frost them too quickly, the icing will melt off.
Frost the cupcakes with your favorite frosting.
The sweet taste of the strawberries pairs well with cream cheese, a simple buttercream or a complementary strawberry frosting.

Try one of these recipes:
 Cream cheese frosting
 Buttercream
 Strawberry frosting Finished.
